overview.description: Arunachal Pradesh, located in northeastern India, is a land of rugged mountains, dense forests, and diverse tribal cultures. Becoming a state on February 20, 1987, it is known for its pristine landscapes, monasteries, and biodiversity hotspots like Namdapha National Park.

top_destinations.name: Tawang
top_destinations.description: Home to the stunning Tawang Monastery and breathtaking Himalayan views.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Carry warm clothing; obtain Inner Line Permit.

top_destinations.name: Ziro Valley
top_destinations.description: A serene valley known for its paddy fields and Apatani tribal culture.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Attend the Ziro Festival; respect local customs.

top_destinations.name: Namdapha National Park
top_destinations.description: A biodiversity hotspot with tigers, elephants, and rare species.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Hire a guide; wear trekking gear.

accommodation.name: Hotel Tawang View
accommodation.description: Luxurious stay with panoramic views in Tawang.

accommodation.name: Pine Grove Resort
accommodation.description: Premium resort nestled in Ziro Valley's greenery.

accommodation.name: Hotel Blue Pine
accommodation.description: Comfortable stay near Namdapha National Park.

accommodation.name: Tourist Lodge Itanagar
accommodation.description: Affordable option in the capital city.

culinary_delights.name: Tawang Gompa Kitchen
culinary_delights.description: Authentic Tibetan dishes near Tawang Monastery.

culinary_delights.name: Ziro Cafe
culinary_delights.description: Offers tribal delicacies like apong and smoked meat.

culinary_delights.name: Namdapha Canteen
culinary_delights.description: Simple yet tasty meals for trekkers.

culinary_delights.name: Sky Chef
culinary_delights.description: Popular for Chinese cuisine in Itanagar.

must_visit_spots.name: Tawang Monastery
must_visit_spots.description: One of the largest monasteries in India with rich Buddhist heritage.
must_visit_spots.tip: Visit during Losar festival for cultural vibes.

must_visit_spots.name: Sela Pass
must_visit_spots.description: A high-altitude pass with stunning snow views.

must_visit_spots.name: Bomdila
must_visit_spots.description: A hill station with monasteries and apple orchards.

must_visit_spots.name: Mechuka Valley
must_visit_spots.description: Remote valley with serene landscapes and Siang River.
must_visit_spots.tip: Best for adventure seekers; plan ahead.

must_visit_spots.name: Parshuram Kund
must_visit_spots.description: Sacred site for Hindu pilgrims with natural beauty.
must_visit_spots.tip: Visit during Makar Sankranti for a spiritual experience.

must_visit_spots.name: Roing
must_visit_spots.description: Gateway to the Mishmi Hills with historical sites.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Itanagar is 400 km from Guwahati (NH27, 10-12 hrs). By air: Lilabari Airport (near Tezu, 200 km). Limited train connectivity via Harmuti.
travel_essentials.tips: Obtain Inner Line Permit; carry warm clothing.
